00018 #ifndef __nec_ground__
00019 #define __nec_ground__
00020 
00021 #include "math_util.h"
00022 
00023 /*
00024         \section{NEC Ground Specification}
00025         
00026         \subsection{the GN Card}
00027         
00028         The GN card specifies the relative dielectric constant and conductivity of ground in the vicinity of the antenna. 
00029         In addition, a second set of ground parameters for a second medium can be specified,
00030         or a radial wire ground screen can be modeled using a reflection coefficient approximation.
00031         
00032         The parameters of the second medium can also be specified on another data card whose mnemonic is GD.
00033         With the GD card, the parameters of the second medium can be varied and only the radiated fields
00034         need to be recalculated.
00035         Furthermore, if a radial wire ground screen has been specified on the GN card,
00036         the GD card is the only way to include a second medium.
00037         See Section~\ref{sec_card_gd} for details.
00038         
00039         \subsection{"gd" card: ground representation}
00040         \label{sec_card_gd}
00041         
00042         To specify the ground parameters of a second medium which is not in the immediate vicinity of the antenna.
00043         This card may only be used if a GN card has also been used.
00044         It does not affect the fields of surface patches.
00045         
00046         <ground type=finite>
00047                 <dielectric_constant = 80/>
00048                 <conductivity = 4/>
00049                 <radial-wire>
00050                         <count=12>
00051                         <length=15 unit=cm>
00052                         <
00053                 </radial-wire>
00054         </ground>
00055         
00056 */
00057 class nec_ground
00058 {
00059 public:
00060 
00061         nec_ground()
00062         {
00063                 default_values();
00064         }
00065         
00066         void default_values()
00067         {
00068                 ksymp=1;
00069                 radial_wire_count=0;
00070                 iperf=0;
00071         }
00072         /*
00073                 Parse a GN card. The input parameters here are the fields of the
00074                 GN card.        
00075         */
00076         void parse_gn(int itmp1, int itmp2,
00077                 nec_float tmp1, nec_float tmp2,
00078                 nec_float tmp3, nec_float tmp4,
00079                 nec_float tmp5, nec_float tmp6
00080                 );
00081         
00082         /*
00083                 Setup a cliff (two medium ground)
00084         */
00085         void setup_cliff(nec_float in_eprs2,
00086                 nec_float in_sig2,
00087                 nec_float clt, nec_float cht);
00088         
00089         nec_complex get_zrati2(nec_float wavelength);
00090         
00091         nec_float get_cl(nec_float wavelength) // cliff edge in wavelengths, 
00092         {
00093                 return cliff_edge_distance / wavelength;
00094         }
00095         
00096         nec_float get_ch(nec_float wavelength) // cliff Height in wavelengths.
00097         {
00098                 return cliff_height / wavelength;
00099         }
00100          
00101         
00102         // accessors for the ground type
00103         inline bool type_finite_reflection()    {       return (0 == iperf); }
00104         inline bool type_perfect()                              {       return (1 == iperf); }
00105         inline bool type_sommerfeld_norton()    {       return (2 == iperf); }
00106         
00107         
00108         bool is_valid()
00109         {
00110                 if (iperf < 0) return false;
00111                 if (iperf > 2) return false;
00112                 
00113                 return true;
00114         }
00115         
00116         int ksymp;
00117         
00118         
00119         nec_float epsr; // relative dielectric constant
00120         nec_float sig;  // Conductivity
00121         
00122         // radial wire ground
00123         int radial_wire_count;
00124         nec_float radial_wire_length;
00125         nec_float radial_wire_radius;
00126         
00127         // second medium parameters
00128         nec_float cliff_edge_distance;
00129         nec_float cliff_height;
00130         nec_float epsr2;        // Relative dielectric constant
00131         nec_float sig2;         // Conductivity in mhos/meter
00132 
00133 private:
00134         /* iperf: Ground-type flag. The options are: 
00135                 -1 - nullifies ground parameters previously used and sets free- space condition. The remainder of the card is left blank in this case. 
00136                 O - finite ground, reflection-coefficient approximation. 
00137                 1 - perfectly conducting ground. 
00138                 2 - finite ground, Sommerfeld/Norton method.
00139         */
00140         int iperf;
00141 };
00142 
00143 #endif /* __nec_ground__ */
